com.radiusnetworks.campaignkit

Interface CampaignKitNotifier


  • public interface CampaignKitNotifier
    The CampaignKitNotifier keeps your app informed when a nearby beacon or geofence has triggered one of your campaigns.

    Implement this notifier in a long running object for your app, such as an Application subclass. This way when you register it with CampaignKitManager.setNotifier(CampaignKitNotifier) the reference will not be garbage collected before the Campaign Kit manager instance. If you notifier instance is garbage collected it's likely the app will crash with a dead object or other similar state leak exception.

    Here's a simplified example: 

    
 public class MyApplication extends Application implements CampaignKitNotifier {
     private static CampaignKitManager sCkManager = null;

     @Override
     public void onCreate() {
         // ... create the manager instance
         sCkManager.setNotifier(this);
         sCkManager.start();
     }

     @Override
     public void didFindCampaign(@NonNull Campaign campaign) {
         Log.d("MyApp", "Did find campaign: " + campaign);
         // Display campaign for user
     }

     @Override
     public void didDetectPlace(@NonNull Place place, @NonNull CKEventType event) {
         Log.d("MyApp", "Did detect event (" + event + ") for place: " + place);
     }

     @Override
     public void didSync() {
         Log.d("MyApp", "didSync");
     }

     @Override
     public void didFailSync(@NonNull Exception e) {
         Log.e("MyApp", "didFailSync", e);
     }
 }

      Category for the type of event causing a call to CampaignKitNotifier.didDetectPlace(Place, CKEventType).

    • Method Detail

      • didDetectPlace

        void didDetectPlace(Place place,
                  CampaignKitNotifier.CKEventType event)
        Invoked when a notable event occurs for a Place.

        This provides access to the lower-level events occurrences around a Place.

        Parameters:
        place - The Place for which the event occurred.
        event - Event type which occurred for the place. Will be any one of the defined CampaignKitNotifier.CKEventType values.

      • didFailSync

        void didFailSync(Exception cause)
        Called after a failed sync of the registered kit with the cloud.

        This indicates that there was a problem retrieving data from the Campaign Kit server. This could indicate a generic network problem, a misconfiguration of the kit URL or authentication token, or a partial data download. The underlying problem is provided with cause.

        Parameters:
        cause - The cause of the failed sync.

      • didFindCampaign

        void didFindCampaign(Campaign campaign)
        Invoked after having entered a Place associated with an active campaign.

        This is only called for active campaigns that have not already been found. Use this notification to take further action related to the campaign. For example, displaying a message within the app.

        Campaigns with a recurrence interval configured will have at most one notification per interval. This means that once a campaign has this notification sent the recurrence interval countdown starts and another notification will not be sent until it has elapsed. Once the interval has passed the device needs to either still be within the place or must re-enter the place for a new notification to occur. 

        
 @Override
 public void didFindCampaign(@NonNull Campaign campaign) {
     if (activeActivity == null) {
         // In the background: store campaign for future reference
         foundCampaigns.add(campaign);
     } else {
         // In the foreground
         new CampaignNotificationBuilder(activeActivity, campaign)
                 .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.ic_launcher)
                 .setOnClickActivity(DetailActivity.class)
                 .sendAlert();
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        campaign - The campaign found by the device.
        See Also:
        CampaignNotificationBuilder

      • didSync

        void didSync()
        Called after a successful sync of the registered the kit with the cloud.

        This indicates that the kit data has successfully been downloaded and loaded from the Campaign Kit server.
